title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the short-run Phillips curve (SRPC) with the inflation rate at 2 percent and the unemployment rate at 5 percent.
descriptions:
No points earned.

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the short-run Phillips curve (SRPC) with the inflation rate at 2 percent and the unemployment rate at 5 percent.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the short-run Phillips curve (SRPC) with the inflation rate at 2 percent and the unemployment rate at 5 percent.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for showing a vertical LRPC at 5 percent unemployment rate.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for showing a vertical LRPC at 5 percent unemployment rate.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for showing a vertical LRPC at 5 percent unemployment rate.

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
3 points

  • One point is earned for stating that AD will increase (OR the AD curve will shift to the right).

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes output to increase, lowering the unemployment rate.

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes the price level to increase, resulting in higher inflation.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for stating that AD will increase (OR the AD curve will shift to the right).

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes output to increase, lowering the unemployment rate.

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes the price level to increase, resulting in higher inflation.

Earns 1 of 3 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that AD will increase (OR the AD curve will shift to the right).

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes output to increase, lowering the unemployment rate.

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes the price level to increase, resulting in higher inflation.

Earns 2 of 3 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that AD will increase (OR the AD curve will shift to the right).

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes output to increase, lowering the unemployment rate.

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes the price level to increase, resulting in higher inflation.

Earns 3 of 3 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that AD will increase (OR the AD curve will shift to the right).

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes output to increase, lowering the unemployment rate.

  • One point is earned for stating that the increase in AD causes the price level to increase, resulting in higher inflation.

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for showing point S on the graph in part (a) with higher inflation but lower unemployment compared to point R on the same short-run Phillips curve.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for showing point S on the graph in part (a) with higher inflation but lower unemployment compared to point R on the same short-run Phillips curve.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for showing point S on the graph in part (a) with higher inflation but lower unemployment compared to point R on the same short-run Phillips curve.

title: Part e.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for concluding that the short-run Phillips curve shifts out (or up).

  • One point is earned for the explanation that with higher wages every level of unemployment is accompanied by a higher rate of inflation. (Inflationary expectations adjust upward to the higher price level in the long run.)
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the short-run Phillips curve shifts out (or up).

  • One point is earned for the explanation that with higher wages every level of unemployment is accompanied by a higher rate of inflation. (Inflationary expectations adjust upward to the higher price level in the long run.)

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the short-run Phillips curve shifts out (or up).

  • One point is earned for the explanation that with higher wages every level of unemployment is accompanied by a higher rate of inflation. (Inflationary expectations adjust upward to the higher price level in the long run.)

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the short-run Phillips curve shifts out (or up).

  • One point is earned for the explanation that with higher wages every level of unemployment is accompanied by a higher rate of inflation. (Inflationary expectations adjust upward to the higher price level in the long run.)
